thread.title: Seychelles reaffirms commitment to promote East3Route concept
thread.title_full: Seychelles reaffirms commitment to promote East3Route concept

author: eTN Editor
title: Seychelles reaffirms commitment to promote East3Route concept
text:
Seychelles reaffirms commitment to promote East3Route concept Adv: 
Aug 04, 2015 Adv: 
The Seychelles Tourism and Culture Minister, Alain St.Ange, has reaffirmed Seychelles’ commitment that the country will be a strong member to defend and promote the concept of East3Route publicly at any forum. 
Minister St.Ange said this while addressing a high-level meeting held as part of the East3Route investment seminar which was held in Seychelles for the first time. 
The East3Route aims to promote and accelerate cross-border economic activity and especially tourism, in its four member countries, namely KwaZulu-Natal (South Africa), Mozambique, Seychelles, and Swaziland. 
Attending the meeting held at the Espace building were the Minister for Commerce, Industry and Trade of Swaziland Gideon Dlamini; Minister of Investment, Entrepreneurship Development and Business Innovation Michael Benstrong; member of the executive council for Economic Development, Tourism and Environmental Affairs KwaZulu-Natal, Michael Mabuyakhulu; and other high officials from all four countries. 
Minister St.Ange said the East3Route will now expand its doors to incorporate ministers of economic developments of the countries, and will sit with the tourism ministers of the four member countries and together become an assembly. 
“To be able to deliver for our countries, we will need to bring culture into the framework of tourism marketing. We have all adopted this strategy that we need to put people at the center of our development, but when we put them in the center of our tourism development, we are putting culture in the center of our development,” he said. 
Minister St.Ange added that there can be no culture without its people. 
He said the four countries will nominate an event of their respective countries which will now be staged in collaboration with the East3Route program. 
“It will help Seychelles to get its culture groups and artists to be in Kwazulu-Natal, Swaziland, and Mozambique to perform alongside the best ones, and the same will apply for all the three countries,” he said. 
He added that now the Vanilla Islands organisation will be affiliated with the East3Route through its member, which is Seychelles. 
“We are growing the family, but it is for one purpose of us working together. The friendly ties are consolidated when the people know each other,” he said. 
“We must action to make these dreams a reality. To make it a reality, we need action, action, and action, as echoed during the East3Route investment seminar which took place at the Savoy Resort and Spa the previous day.” 
Minister St.Ange added that it has been a dream to have the East3Route investment seminar in Seychelles. 
Seychelles is a founding member of the International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) . Source: Seychelles Ministry of Tourism and Culture
